article:
'Immediately adjacent', in legal usage, generally means "adjoining or abutting,
rather than in the vicinity". See, e.g., Parsons v Wethersfield, 135 Conn 24, 60
A2d 771, 4 ALR2d 330 - This definition of the term was given in a statutory
provision requiring a unanimous vote of the commission on a question of rezoning
property over the protest of 20 per cent of the owners of lots "immediately
adjacent".
